More and more people who feel threatened by chainlink (Augur fanboys, Witnet idealists, uniswap fanatics, Bitcoin maxis) are fighting tooth and nail against it, even though they don't actually understand what Chainlink is or how it works

"in the past 10 days, Chainlink sold 3.5 million LINK, worth $10.8 million, in five batches of 700,000, according to records on Etherscan. As a result, the token’s price fell nearly 25 percent to $3.10."

The only way Chainlink succeeds is by going trusted to trustless by piggybacking on the trust that already exists to jumpstart the network, then easing people in over time into using automated trustless agreements. This is smart game theory trumping unrealistic idealism.

2) Chainlink is both an oracle and a framework for matching smart contracts with oracles. In regards to the framework, they are simply providing tools so developers can design any type of oracle design pattern they need.

3) Chainlink seems to be going for network effects, where a smart contract can get any input/output in one location. To build a network that the top companies in the world will actually trust enough to use, you have to leverage the current trust in the system to grow the network.
